isis.stitle: HYDRO-MAX™ BRAKE BOOSTER AND MASTER CYLINDER - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubsecinfo.para: Before checking the brake system, the following related components on the vehicle should be examined and serviced if found defective, as they can affect braking performance.
The TROUBLESHOOTING CHART in this section is an aid for determining the type of brake service required. This chart also lists possible conditions and corrections.

Braking problems accompanied by steering problems may indicate a faulty power steering pump. If symptoms suggest such a problem, pump output pressure and flow tests should be conducted. Refer to GROUP 05 - STEERING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

The troubleshooting of problems in the Hydro-Max™ power brake and split hydraulic brake system is presented in chart form on the basis of condition, possible cause and correction. The charts are designed to minimize the time spent in servicing the Hydro-Max™ and Master Cylinder systems.

svcproc.title: ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING
svcproc.para: Additional conditions affecting the electrical operation of the brake monitoring system and backup pump can be found in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
